verses.roman:
tāṅra preme āni' āmāya karāya bhojane
antare mānaye sukha, bāhye nāhi māne

synonyms: tāṅra preme—by her love; āni'-bringing; āmāya—Me; karāya bhojane—causes to eat; antare—within herself; mānaye—she feels; sukha—happiness; bāhye—externally; nāhi māne—does not accept.
translation: "Being obliged by her love, I am brought there to eat. Mother knows all these things internally and feels happiness, but externally she does not accept them.
